metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0041 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In binder_transaction of binder.c, there is a possible out of bounds writedue to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-145988638References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-lowlatency - 5.4.0-18.22
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

No subscription required
